title.narrative: Prevention and Response to Acute Trafficking in People, Mental Health and Psychosocial Concerns in North-East Nigeria

description.narrative: Building on existing capacities and in response to the identified needs and vulnerabilities of the crisis affected population in north-east Nigeria, IOM will under this project aim to ensure the following outcomes (1) improved mental health and psychosocial wellbeing among crisis-affected populations through direct service provision and capacity-building of local and national institutions; (2) improved access to trafficking in persons prevention and response services of at-risk sub-groups of the crisis-affected population by direct service provision and capacity-building of national and local institutions. These components are implemented with the objective to prevent and respond to acute trafficking in persons, mental health and psychosocial concerns in north-east Nigeria. In line with the principles of the Humanitarian Development Nexus and the New Way of Working the two components are underpinned by the promotion of collective transition outcomes. This is made explicit by the project design, in particular thediscrete focus to invest in local capacities, the promotion of resilience among the most vulnerable of the crisis-affected population, and the restorations of collective structures and systems essential for the resumption of daily life and transitioning out of crisis. Activitiesproposed under this project are coordinated under the framework of the Humanitarian Response Plan for Nigeria (2019 – 2020).
